cards.flavor: Every journey starts with a small splash.
cards.name: A Journey Begins (SL04)
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor:
Valery stood, a mad gleam in her eye. “Come on.” She said. “We're going to rob the Devil blind.”
—Azamir, “The Thief of Life”
cards.name: Ambitious Necromancer (SL02)
cards.originalText: Sabotage — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.text: Sabotage — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
“The reinforcements finally arrived. All they could do was help carry the bodies.”
— Azamir, “Fall of Golden Company”
cards.name: Backup Forces (SL02)
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your end step, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.

cards.flavor: On Novea, even the smallest seed of life begins growing at an alarming rate...

cards.flavor: It's the place that you've been dreaming of.
cards.name: Dreamsight Well (SL03)
cards.originalText: Shuffle up to five cards you own from outside the game into your library. Then if your library contains at least forty cards more than the minimum deck size, draw five cards.
cards.text: Shuffle up to five cards you own from outside the game into your library. Then if your library contains at least forty cards more than the minimum deck size, draw five cards.

cards.flavor:
“Complacency. Weakness. Temptation. Despair. To ascend to Langan, you must defeat them all, and not die trying.”
—Liguno, Who Transcends All
cards.name: Epic Encounter (SL04)
cards.originalText: You may reveal a legendary card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. Exile Epic Encounter.
cards.text: You may reveal a legendary card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. Exile Epic Encounter.

cards.flavor: The stars look very different today...
cards.name: Event Horizon (SL04)
cards.originalText: Exile target nonland permanent if its converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of nonland permanents on the battlefield.
cards.text: Exile target nonland permanent if its converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of nonland permanents on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Here comes the sun.

Destroy all creatures.

cards.flavor: In a single blast, the fleet was ripped apart, torn apart by the fire and the flames alike.

cards.originalText:
When Flare Blitz enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: “Start the countdown. 5. 4. 3. 2. 1. You're go for launch.”

cards.flavor:
“There's a whole multiverse out there!” He said excitedly. “We can go anywhere, do anything, anytime we want!”
—Azamir, “Planeswalker's Whimsy”
cards.name: Infinite Dreams (SL02)
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your end step, shuffle your hand and graveyard into your library, then draw seven cards.
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, shuffle your hand and graveyard into your library, then draw seven cards.

cards.flavor: “There's part of me that longs to go.”

cards.originalText:
When Into the Unknown enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 Scout creature tokens that are all colors.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, if it doesn't have the same name as another land you control, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: She frantically banged on the pod window, tears streaming down her face, calling for him to get inside. He gave her a rueful grin and said four words — “Be happy without me” — and pushed off into the void.

cards.originalText: Put all creatures on the bottom of their owners' libraries.

cards.flavor: Zhedina Excursion Authority will not be held liable for damages caused by heat stroke, cold feet, aberrant insect swarms...

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are six or more cards in your graveyard, you may transform Scuttling Gnat.

cards.flavor: ...global dragon attacks, localized dragon attacks, cross-fire from any conflicts involving apian, avian, reptilian, marsupial, or ursine parties, including that of falling debris and bodies...

cards.flavor:
“I turned around, and there was nothing there. Nothing but the void. The end is here.”
—Captain Phoebe

cards.flavor: The strands of darkness pull, and soon enough, there's no way to escape their gravity.

“The Emperor's name is scorched into every blasted landscape he created.”
—Azamir, “The Empire's Sunset”

cards.flavor:
“The strange creature had stopped moving. But, Ersten was patient. They could get all the rest they needed. He would wait.”
—Azamir, “Of Moss and Men”
